page.title: 05HOGGANFIELD LOCH
page.content: {Hogganfield Loch}was originally used to supply water for the mills of the city via the Molendinar Burn. Officially opened as a park in 1924, it has a walkway round the water, and lots of grassland. The island in the middle of the Loch is an official { {Bird Sanctuary.}In addition to the ducks and swans it provides a home for coots, moorhens, Canadian geese and snow geese. Throughout the year Hogganfield Loch is visited by the local people - joggers, people sunbathing and having picnics on the grass, families taking a trip round the Loch in the motor boats and anglers fishing for pike and perch. It is used for watersports and there is also a boating club for Glasgow schools. Presently there are two sanded areas being constructed which young children will enjoy.
